duties_responsibilities.duty: Review and interpret medical records to evaluate the validity of payer denials.
Follow-up on submitted claims in accordance with payer and facility policies, research rejections and denials, document account activity, post adjustments.
Prepare and submit clean claims to all insurance companies either electronically or by paper.
Research and resolve claim holds/rejections and denials. Verify patient benefits, eligibility, and coverage as needed.
Draft appeal letters to insurance companies to overturn denied or underpaid claims; rebill claims as necessary including additional documentation.
Maintain current on all private and government payer billing regulations and policy for denial prevention.
Assess accuracy of demographic and policy information within patient accounts and updates as needed.
Respond to correspondence and phone calls related to patient accounts and answer billing and charge related inquires by patients, staff, managed care organizations, etc.
Communicate daily with internal and external customers via phone calls and written communications.
Assist in patient collections and reconciling deposit.
Identify billing or coding issues and request re-bills, secondary billing, or corrected bills as needed.
Research billing and collection trends, problems, and issues that result in delayed claim processing and denials.
Document all communication and transactions in patient accounts accurately and completely.
Draft appeal letters to insurance companies to overturn denied or underpaid claims; rebill claims as necessary including additional documentation.
Maintain patient confidence and protect medical office operations by keeping patient information confidential.
Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Communicate with Leads to identify and resolve all RCM issues.
Pursue and participate in education to remain current with changes in the Healthcare industry.

education_certification.credential: Minimum of 2 years related experience in a medical billing setting and/or experience with an Electronic Medical Record a plus. EPIC Certification preferred
